sen.j: 西園寺 公晃（さいおんじ きんあき、元禄15年7月11日 (旧暦)（1702年8月4日） - 明和7年8月21日 (旧暦)（1770年10月9日））は、江戸時代中期の公卿。
sen.e: Kinaki SAIONJI (August 4, 1702 – October 9, 1770) was a court noble in the middle of Edo period.
Kinaki SAIONJI (August 4, 1702 – October 9, 1770) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the middle of Edo period.
sen.cmt: Kugyoを追加し、court nobleを大文字にしました。
sen.e: Kinaki SAIONJI (August 4, 1702 – October 9, 1770) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the middle of Edo period.

sen.j: 主に中御門天皇（114代）・桜町天皇（115代）・桃園天皇（116代）の三帝にわたって奉仕し、官位は従一位内大臣まで昇っている。
sen.e: He mainly served for three emperors: Emperor Nakamikado (the 114th), Emperor Sakuramachi (the 115th), and Emperor Momozono (the 116th), and he rose to Juichii-naidaijin (minister of the center at the Junior First Rank).

He primarily served for the three emperors: the 114th Emperor Nakamikado, the 115th Emperor Sakuramachi, and the 116th Emperor Momozono; He was promoted up to "Juichii Naidaijin"(Junior First Rank and Minister of the Center).
sen.cmt: mainly→primarily, three emperors→the three emperorsを訂正しました。天皇の何代の位置を移動しました。役職の頭文字を大文字に訂正しました。minister of the center at the Junior First Rank→Junior First Rank and Minister of the Center他のファイルとの表現を統一するため訂正しました。
sen.e: He primarily served for the three emperors: the 114th Emperor Nakamikado, the 115th Emperor Sakuramachi, and the 116th Emperor Momozono; He was promoted up to "Juichii Naidaijin"(Junior First Rank and Minister of the Center).

sen.j: 父は左大臣西園寺致季。
sen.e: His father was Sadaijin (minister of the left), Munesue SAIONJI.
His father was Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) Munesue SAIONJI.
sen.cmt: 役職の頭文字を大文字に訂正しました。
sen.e: His father was Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) Munesue SAIONJI.
His mother was "ie no nyobo" (a lady-in-waiting).
His mother was "Ie no Nyobo" (Lady-in-Waiting).
sen.cmt: 役職の頭文字を大文字に訂正しました。
sen.e: His mother was "Ie no Nyobo" (Lady-in-Waiting).

sen.j: 養父に鷹司兼熙（大伯父にあたる）がいる。
sen.e: His foster father was Kanehiro TAKATSUKASA (his granduncle).
His adoptive father was Kanehiro TAKATSUKASA who was his granduncle.
sen.cmt: foster→adoptiveに訂正しました。Who wasを追加しました。
sen.e: His adoptive father was Kanehiro TAKATSUKASA who was his granduncle.
His wife was a daughter of Koresue IMADEGAWA.
His wife was a daughter of Koresue IMADEGAWA.
His wife was a daughter of Koresue IMADEGAWA.

sen.j: 子に右大臣西園寺賞季、右大臣徳大寺実祖・内大臣今出川実種がいる。
sen.e: His sons were Udaijin (minister of the right) Yoshisue SAIONJI, Udaijin Sanemi TOKUDAIJI, and Naidaijin (minister of the center) Sanetane IMADEGAWA.
He had several children, including Udaijin (Minister of the Right) Yoshisue SAIONJI, Udaijin Sanemi TOKUDAIJI, and Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) Sanetane IMADEGAWA.
sen.cmt: His sons were→He had several children, includingに訂正しました。役職の頭文字を大文字に訂正しました。
sen.e: He had several children, including Udaijin (Minister of the Right) Yoshisue SAIONJI, Udaijin Sanemi TOKUDAIJI, and Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) Sanetane IMADEGAWA.
In 1720, he was conferred a peerage.
In 1720, he was conferred a peerage.
In 1720, he was conferred a peerage.

sen.j: 以降清華家当主として速いスピードで昇進し、享保10年（1725年）には従三位となり公卿に列する。
sen.e: Since then he got promoted quickly as the head of the Seiga family (one of the highest court noble families in Japan at that time), and in 1725, he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and he was raised to the court nobles.

Since then, as the head of the Seiga family (the second highest family status for the court noble in Japan at that time), he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period; In 1725, he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), which gave him the title Kugyo.
sen.cmt: 他の西園寺ファイルとの整合性をとるため、全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: Since then, as the head of the Seiga family (the second highest family status for the court noble in Japan at that time), he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period; In 1725, he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), which gave him the title Kugyo.

sen.j: その後も踏歌節会外弁や中納言を経て、享保17年（1732年）から元文3年（1738年）、寛延3年（1750年）から宝暦3年（1753年）までの二度にかけて大納言を務めた。
sen.e: Then he became Toka no sechie Geben [a court noble who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie (Imperial Court Ceremony)] and Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), and he served as Dainagon (chief councilor of state) twice from 1732 to 1738 and from 1750 to 1753.

Then he became "Toka no Sechie Geben" (Court Noble who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie [Imperial Court Ceremony]) and Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State); He served as Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State) twice; One was the period between 1732 and 1738, and another was between 1750 and 1753.
sen.cmt: 役職の頭文字を大文字にし、複数の単語で連なる役職に""を追加しました。カッコの表記を訂正しました。One was the between, another wasを追加しました。
sen.e: Then he became "Toka no Sechie Geben" (Court Noble who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie [Imperial Court Ceremony]) and Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State); He served as Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State) twice; One was the period between 1732 and 1738, and another was between 1750 and 1753.

sen.j: 宝暦3年（1753年）に大歌所別当に補された。
sen.e: In 1753, he was appointed as the chief officer of Outadokoro (Folk Music Office).
In 1753, he was appointed as the chief officer of Outadokoro (Folk Music Office).
In 1753, he was appointed as the chief officer of Outadokoro (Folk Music Office).

sen.j: 宝暦5年（1755年）に近衛府に転じ、さらに内大臣となるも翌年に辞職した。
sen.e: In 1755, he was transferred to the Division of Inner Palace Guards, then became Naidaijin, but resigned a year later.
In 1755, he was transferred to the Division of Inner Palace Guards, and became Naidaijin; Nevertheless, he resigned the position the next year.
sen.cmt: then→and, but→; Neverthelessに訂正しました。resigned a year later→he resigned the position the next yearに訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1755, he was transferred to the Division of Inner Palace Guards, and became Naidaijin; Nevertheless, he resigned the position the next year.

sen.j: 宝暦10年（1760年）に従一位が授与される。
sen.e: In 1760, he was conferred Juichii (Junior First Rank).
In 1760, he was conferred Juichii (Junior First Rank).
In 1760, he was conferred Juichii (Junior First Rank).
